arch:Archive.foaf:name: Willamette University Archives and Special Collections
arch:Archive.nwda:visitation: Willamette University Archives and Special Collections is located on the 2nd floor of the Mark O. Hatfield Library and is open 9:00 - noon; 1:00 - 4:00 Monday - Friday, with the exception of Willamette University holidays. The Archives and Special Collections welcomes users from the Willamette community as well as members of the public.
arch:Archive.nwda:facsimile: A list of reproduction services offered by the Archives and Special Collections is available here: http://library.willamette.edu/archives/policies/repro/ For permission to publish, quote, broadcast, perform, or exhibit, contact the University Archivist at: http://library.willamette.edu/archives/contact/
arch:Archive.dcterms:description: Archives and Special Collections collects, preserves, and makes available University records of enduring value and primary source materials focusing on the Northwest. This rich collection is a valuable resource for researchers, historians and the general public. Of particular note are Congressional and political papers and the Pacific Northwest Artists Archive. Special Collections include such treasures as a 15th century book of hours, a second folio edition of Shakespeare's plays, and a first edition of Samuel Johnson's dictionary.
